name: manipulated
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
past simple and past participle of
manipulate
manipulate verb [T]
(INFLUENCE)
mainly disapproving to control something or someone to your advantage, often unfairly or dishonestly: Throughout her career she has very successfully manipulated the media. The opposition leader accused government ministers of manipulating the statistics to suit themselves.

manipulate verb [T]
(USE HANDS)
to control something using the hands: The wheelchair is designed so that it is easy to manipulate.
to treat a part of the body, using the hands to push back bones into the correct position and put pressure on muscles: The doctor manipulated the base of my spine and the pain disappeared completely.
